page.title: 01THE HORNCASTLE AREA
page.content:
The area contains all but a small part of Horncastle, an historic town which lies at the foot of the scenic Lincolnshire Wolds. The remainder of the Survey Block is composed of undulating land curving down to the open valley of the River Bain and its small tributary, the Waring.
Horncastle dates back at least to Roman times, when a wall enlosed some 7 acres. Right from those times it has acted as a local centre for the surrounding farmlands, which are of uniformly high quality.
It reached its greatest population in 1851, when over 5000 people made a living from trade and small industries. Today, there are 4200 inhabitants, many of whom now travel outside the town to work.
